alert.note: Alert for Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Western Rutland; Western Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 4:31PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Rutland and southwestern Windsor Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 430 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pawlet, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chester, Woodstock, Pawlet, Mount Holly, Ludlow, Cavendish, Mount Tabor, Weston, Andover, Tinmouth, Ludlow Village, Wallingford, Mt. Holly, Mt. Tabor, Danby, Plymouth, Baltimore, Reading, Shrewsbury and Wells. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Western Rutland; Western Windsor
